title: The Last Letter from the Lighthouse
premise: A reclusive cartographer, still grieving the fiancé she lost at sea a decade ago, is hired to survey a remote coastal town, only to discover the local lighthouse keeper is the man she thought was dead. Forced to work together to save the historic beacon, they must navigate a sea of unsent letters, unspoken truths, and a storm of old feelings that never truly faded.
protagonist: Elara Vance, a meticulous mapmaker who has built a safe, ordered life to contain her past.
conflict: Elara must reconcile the ghost she mourned with the living, breathing man who left without explanation, while he grapples with the guilt of his disappearance and the secret that forced him to vanish, all as a powerful developer threatens to tear down the lighthouse that is now their only common ground.
setting: Present-day, the windswept and misty fictional island of Halcyon Bay, Maine, during the volatile autumn storm season.
tone: Atmospheric, poignant, and quietly yearning, with a undercurrent of hope battling against the ghosts of the past.
